etymology.description: 㚔 (handcuffs) + 𠬝 (to subdue) = to convict or declare guilty -> report; announce
etymology.interpretation: The character 報(bào) conveys the idea of delivering a verdict or making an official announcement, stemming from the imagery of handcuffs and subdual, which symbolize an authoritative declaration of guilt.
etymology.simplification: 報 was simplified to 报 through sound-alike replacement with 押(押) (yā, "press"), retaining the idea of administering announcements but using the simpler form.

examples.chinese: 记者報最新消息(記者報最新消息)。
examples.english: The reporter reported the latest news.

examples.chinese: 听到火警铃声(聽到火警鈴聲)，他立刻報警(他立刻報警)。
examples.pinyin: Tīngdào huǒjǐng língshēng, tā lìkè bào jǐng.
examples.english: Hearing the fire alarm, he immediately called the police.

examples.chinese: 校长報考试成绩(校長報考試成績)。
examples.english: The principal reported the exam results.
